description: Modified from Harrison et al., 1980. A broad spectrum artifical seawater medium for coastal and open ocean phytoplankton. The final salt concentration is ~34 ppt.
before_start: Acid washed all glassware with 10% HCl and rinse well (3-5 times with deionized or ultrapure water depending on downstream application). Prepare L1 medium components, L1 trace element solution and f/2 vitamin mix ahead of time.
manuscript_citation:
Harrison, P. J., Waters, R. E. and Taylor, F. J. R. (1980), A BROAD SPECTRUM ARTIFICIAL SEA WATER MEDIUM FOR COASTAL AND OPEN OCEAN PHYTOPLANKTON1. Journal of Phycology, 16: 28–35. doi:10.1111/j.0022-3646.1980.00028.x

 

Bigelow National Center for Marine Algae and Microbiota, “L1 Medium.”, ncma.bigelow.org/media/wysiwyg/Algal_recipes/NCMA_algal_medium_L1_1.pdf.
guidelines: Prepare solutions separately, autoclave (or filter sterilize as needed), and then mix to prevent precipitation of salts. When autoclaving, use a bottle at least twice the size of the needed volume (e.g. use a 1 L bottle to autoclave 500 mL). Solutions should sit for 24-48 hr after autoclaving to allow for gaseous exchanges. N, P, Si, and trace element components are from the Bigelow NCMAM L1 medium; Vitamin components are from the Bigelow NCMAM f/2 medium. Trace metal and vitamin solutions can be made ahead of time and aliquots stored frozen.
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

source_data.description: Prepare solution 1.

source_data.guidelines: Glassware should be acid-washed and rinsed well with dH2O before use. If unable to measure small quantities accurately, either scale up the recipe or prepare stock solutions of the individual compounds.

source_data.description: Dissolve 10.595 g NaCl into the bottle.
Dissolve 1.775 g Na2SO4 into the bottle.
Dissolve 0.2795 g KCl into the bottle.
Dissolve 43.1 mg Kbr into the bottle.
Dissolve 0.1145 g H3BO3 into the bottle.
Dissolve 1.375 mg NaF into the bottle.
Dissolve 86.75 mg NaHCO3 into the bottle.

components.data: Mix final solution well and set aside until ready to autoclave.
components.name: Description

components.data: Autoclave solutions 1 and 2 and let sit 24-48 hours for gas exchange.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Autoclave solutions 1 and 2 and let sit 24-48 hours for gas exchange.
Combine solutions 1 and 2.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 5 of Artificial Seawater Medium
source_data.annotation: If a solution has some precipitate, consider filtering solution(s) before or after combining through a 0.2 micron PES membrane.
source_data.thread_text: If a solution has some precipitate, consider filtering solution(s) before or after combining through a 0.2 micron PES membrane.
source_data.body: If a solution has some precipitate, consider filtering solution(s) before or after combining through a 0.2 micron PES membrane.

source_data.description: Prepare solution 2.

source_data.before_start:
Prepare primary stock solutions (in dH2O) of the following:

  • NaNO3: 75.00 g/L
  • NaH2PO4·H2O: 5.00 g/L
  • Na2SiO3·9HO: 30.00 g/L (Note: this will only be used if phytoplankton require silicates)

Filter sterilize through a 0.2 micron PES membrane and store frozen in 1 mL aliquots.
source_data.guidelines: First, prepare primary stock solutions. Glassware should be acid-washed and rinsed well with dH2O before use. If unable to measure small quantities accurately, either scale up the recipe or prepare additional stock solutions of the individual compounds.

source_data.description: Dissolve 4.796 g MgCl2·6H2O into bottle.
Dissolve 0.672 g CaCl2·2H2O into bottle.
Dissolve 10.95 mg SrCl2·6H2O into bottle.
NaNO3: 1 ml primary stock solution (75.00 g/L)
NaH2PO4·H2O: 1 ml primary stock solution (5.00 g/L)
Na2SiO3· 9H2O (optional): 1 ml primary stock solution (30.00 g/L)

L1 trace element solution, modified from Bigelow: NCMAM Center. Components to prepare 1 L of trace element solution.
source_data.before_start:
Prepare primary stock solutions (in dH2O) of the following:

  • MnCl2·4H2O: 178.10 g/L
  • ZnSO4·7H2O: 23.00 g/L
  • CoCl2·6H2O: 11.90 g/L
  • CuSO4·5H2O: 2.50 g/L
  • Na2MoO4·2H2O: 19.9 g/L
  • H2SeO3: 1.29 g/L
  • NiSO4·6H2O: 2.63 g/L
  • Na3VO4: 1.84 g/L
  • K2CrO: 1.94 g/L

Filter sterilize individual solutions through a 0.2 micron PES membrane.

Store frozen in 1 mL aliquots.

Dissolve 3.15 g FeCl3·6H2O into the bottle.
Dissolve 4.36 g Na2EDTA·2H2O into the bottle.
Store frozen in 1 mL aliquots.
Add 0.5 mL of f/2 vitamin solution.
Modified from Bigelow: NCMAM Center. Components to prepare 1 L of f/2 vitamin solution.
source_data.before_start:
Prepare primary stock solutions (in dH2O) of the following:

  • biotin 0.1 g/L
  • cyanocobalamin: 1.0 g/L

Filter sterilize through a 0.2 micron PES membrane and store frozen in 1 mL aliquots.
source_data.guidelines: First, prepare primary stock solutions. To prepare final solution, begin with 950 mL of dH2O (autoclaved), dissolve the thiamine, add the amounts of the primary stocks indicated, and bring final volume to 1.0 liter with dH2O. Filter sterilize. Store in refrigerator or freezer.
